metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3247 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: Merge). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.41 and prior,5.7.23 and prior and 8.0.12 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerabilityallows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocolsto compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server as well as unauthorized update, insertor delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 BaseScore 5.5 (Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3247` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
